title: Friend climbed to platinum after making new account to escape bronze. Elo hell?
body:
Hey guys I never believed in all the people saying Elo hell exists. I always just told my bronze friend to get good and climb but he said it's too hard. I told him if he's so good level a new account and prove you aren't bronze then. He leveled a new account over a few months and typical of new accounts it got placed into silver 5. He was so excited not to be in bronze so he started to play more ranked. Lo and behold, he began to climb pretty fast. Somehow he managed to climb using sona despite seeing a lot of yasuos everywhere and zeds. I thought he'd just be able to climb a little but infact he didn't. He made it all the way to platinum 2. Looking back he says he didn't really improve at all. He says bronze was just elo hell and even now he couldn't escape.

Now idk if elo hell is real or not and I'm pretty sceptical still but this was strange to see. I'm not gonna blame my teammates or whatever because I didn't think it existed in the first place but this is a shock to me. I can't show his account because it's naming and shaming technically but what do you think?


1 Year later edit: This was fake

Yeah, the reason vlad's so "OP" in bronze/silver right now is because literally nobody buys grievous wounds items unless it's directly in their natural buildpath (like morellos on mages). Oh, and flanking is just one of the ways to get free kills/freelo with him in bronze. With rylai's, you can more often than not go the whole "front door" strategy where you r/q/e/w directly onto them and nab free kills that way.

Now let you inform you why you're wrong about {{item:3123}} . And no, I'm not being cocky/belittling you. 

Tank Vlad (Protobelt, Visage, etc) is exactly why Vlad is considered weak right now. The core of that build is the combination of sustain+tankiness to simply stat-check most champions. Yes, GW heavily affects that build. 

However, any Vlad main knows that full AP (Abyssal, Zhonya's, Ionian, Rylai's, Deathcap, Void Staff) is the way to play him. Average (between CR and non) 182.5% AP on a 3 second CD late game; more than enough 1-shot any non-tank. 

___________

Full AP Vlad is all about his absurd damage; not the healing at all. The healing is just a superfluous bonus to me. 

Grievous Wounds does little-to-nothing to Vlad for this reason. Outside of all-ins, you won't have GW consistently applied, so if you don't 1 shot him, he will sustain up anyway. 

In addition, full AP Vlad heals more than Vlad with Visage, though it seems ironic. The healing you get even through GW is enough to turn most 1v1s either way. 

If Vlad times his trades/engages around Crimson Rush, you simply don't win vs him unless you counter him as specific all-in champ AND outplay him. Why? Because he simply won't let you engage on him and can out-trade you unless you're Irelia/Riven with hexdrinker. 

_______

A well played Vlad is good at consistently solo carrying games anywhere below plat because he's almost immune to aggression while having windows where he can heavily out-trade most champions. Even if you get camped, you can out-play and can't be safely dove. Even if they send 3-4 top, in many cases you can get out; sometimes even turn. This makes him an extremely strong split-pusher AND teamfighter. 

However, you can't do that if you use the tank build. You must play AP if you want to be consistently successful on Vlad. 

___________

Its called elo hell for a few reasons.

1) New players who just reached level 30 will more often than not go straight to ranked once its available. If youre in bronze, chances are you will see said new player on your team. Said new player is new and doesnt understand all the characters mechanics or really much of the game. You have a really high chance of losing with thatn ew player on your team.

1a) the same can be said for the opposing team.

2) Smurfs on your team or the enemy team.

3) You suck, your teammates despite not being new play casually - few games a week or a month even and thus they suck. 

4) You're in elo hell, so your tilt meter is already halfway. You or your teammates dont know how to come back from early or mid game disadvantages or to close out games. You dont work together as a team. This one is true for up to even gold elo from what i've heard.

Oh but a hardstuck Silver is an entirely different story. 55% of the community is in Silver, which suggests that is where Riot has designed its mean to be.

And, the difference in skill between some Silver players and Plat players are often Nil; The reason the silver player is not in Plat is because of a combination of his Team, and the fact he randomizes what champs he plays. Most plats are good with 2-3 Champs, and only play them. Silver players are usually good with 2-3 champions, but they BELIEVE they are good with 15-20. But if you put that Silver player with a 2-3 Champion proficiency in Plat, they'll usually do okay, or at least resist an elo reduction. But when they start playing their 15-20 in Plat, their MMR begins to plummet.

I won't go as far as to say some Silvers can play with Diamond, because in reality, Diamonds are pretty close to Masters.... just not making the cut. They legitimately can play 20 Champions, and the other ~130 champs they know mechanically well enough to compete at Plat. There's a HUGE skill gap there.

But the most important thing regarding climbing is a team. Silver by and large doesn't have one. Gold has enough of a team to be reactive to invasive jungling, and lane roams, and to congregate at the right times and the right vision to take objectives. Plat is all that, and many are on comms with friends, which means they have synergies, and better prepare their teams on the onset.

But.... Gold and Plat are still very snowbally. They throw caution to the wind if they think they can come out 10% ahead of the other team in a skirmish, whereas Diamond will generally respect the other team enough to not take that chance, focus on farming, and ONLY use skills on opponents when there is an absolute purpose to the damage, and won't get cancelled out by some life regen.

I started playing league in season 3. I was bronze 5 - bronze 2 the first 6 months, I managed to get to silver 3 at the end of Season 3. After that, I had a constant climb. Reached Gold for the first time season 4, plat season 5, got stuck plat season 6 and now omw to diamond. 
There is no elo hell, the only hell there is, is your mind. You're the only one holding yourself back. You may think it's your allies, but it is you. If someone plays bad and you get toxic or tilted, it is partly your fault, because you have a weak mind. Sorry, but that's the truth.
You can learn to accept it and change your attitude. a good attitude makes you play better, carry more games and win more often. That's a fact, I do not need statistics or conspiracy theories to say that.

Start every game with the will to win, do not even think of losing. If you lose anyways, than swallow it, it happens. Just keep going and try as hard as possible. Do not flame and blame your team, because what has happened, can not be undone. It doesn't matter who is at fault, because you cannot change it.
